results.title: Skyhook
results.brief_description: How the helicopter was used to set up a drilling rig at Sireru in a remote area of Papua. A whole oil camp was lifted piece by piece into the middle of the jungle by helicopter, thus solving one of the biggest problems, that of oil transportation, for in a country with a rainfall of up to 350 inches a year it may take three months to build a road.

results.title: Sky trackers: Family and self
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Margot McDonald, Steve Steve Jodrell and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: Sky trackers is a television series about children, parents and the universe, which combines lively action, strong emotion, high adventure and the cutting edge of science. “Sky trackers: Family and self” includes three stories dealing with human relationships; “Letting go” Mike and his dad are forced to revisit the death of their mother/wife several years ago. “Rocket to me” Nikki and Mike’s complaints about parental demands are dwarfed by the discovery that a friend is subjected to physical and psychological violence. “Origins” Cleo discovers she is adopted and resents her “parents” who have hidden the facts from her. This curriculum package comes with a guide book and is designed for use by teachers of upper primary and junior secondary school (years 5-8).

results.title: Sky trackers
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Australian Children's Television Foundation and John Power
results.brief_description: It started as innocent fun and turned into an adventure of galactic proportions! Ali (Maia Brewton) lives on a NASA Satellite Tracking Station where her Mum (Pamela Sue Martin) works as a space scientist. A computer whiz, Ali spends her spare time hacking into the station’s mainframe to record her personal diary. One evening while hacking into the computer she discovers a runaway satellite is out of control and heading straight for Earth and is likely to crash nearby. What she doesn’t know is that the satellite contains a load of deadly cargo, so dangerous it threatens the safety of the entire world…

results.title: Sky sailing: waiting for the wind
results.creator_credit: Marie Schurrer, Alex Ciecierski and Huemark Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the preparation and inspection of the hang glider prior to use, and shows learners receiving preliminary training before their first jump. The hang glider is shown in action, with a commentary describing techniques of sky sailing. Narrated by Stacey Foster.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marie Schurrer, Alex Ciecierski and Huemark Films

results.title: Sky riders
results.brief_description: Lightweight history of aviation using archival inserts of earlier flights and varieties of aircraft, from the Wright Brothers to the 18 hour trans-continental flight (ie San Francisco to New York).

results.title: Sky rider
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, Phoenix Films and John Halas
results.brief_description: An animated satire on space travel, with a central character representing “the man in the street” who takes his rocket to a galaxy and to satellites, well ahead of the Russian and American astronauts. The various forms of simple animation used in this film would provide an excellent motivation for students of animation techniques. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Sky Pirates
results.creator_credit: John Lamond Motion Pictures Production, John Lamond, Michael Hirsh and Colin Eggleston
results.brief_description: Set during World War II, this film is about a plane crashing into the Pacific Ocean and the survivors finding themselves in a time warp. Stars John Hargreaves, Meredith Phillips and Max Phipps.

results.title: Sky pirates
results.creator_credit: Frank Godwin, Ansus Films and C M Pennington-Richards
results.brief_description: When their model plane crashes at the Aero Club, Mike and Harry are befriended by ex-pilot, Charlie Bradford, and his niece, Maggie, who teach them to fly radio controlled planes. Charlie invites them to the test flight of his new long distance aircraft which is later stolen. When they learn that a diamond has been stolen from the French State Museum, they realise the plane is to be used to smuggle the diamond out of the country.

results.title: Sky Dive
results.brief_description: The World’s leading filmer of skydiving, Carl Boenish, has now spent twenty-one hours in free fall. This film shows the most spectacular scenes. Skydivers plunge off into the air from a 3,000 ft cliff
